1:
I will give thanks to Yahweh with my whole heart;\q I will tell about all your marvelous deeds.
\q
2:
I will be glad and rejoice in you;\q I will sing praise to your name, Most High!


\q
3:
When my enemies turn back,\q they stumble and perish before you.
\q
4:
For you have defended my just cause;\q you sit on your throne, a righteous judge!


\q
6:
The enemy crumbled like ruins\q when you overthrew their cities.
\q All remembrance of them has perished.


\q
7:
But Yahweh remains forever;\q he has established his throne for justice.
\q
8:
He will judge the world with righteousness,\q and he will execute judgment for the nations with fairness.


\q
9:
Yahweh also will be a stronghold for the oppressed,\q a stronghold in times of trouble.
\q
10:
Those who know your name trust in you,\q for you, Yahweh, do not abandon those who seek you.


\q
11:
Sing praises to Yahweh, who rules in Zion;\q tell the nations what he has done.
\q
12:
For the God who avenges bloodshed remembers;\q he does not forget the cry of the oppressed.


\q
13:
Have mercy on me, Yahweh; see how I am oppressed by those who hate me,\q you who can snatch me from the gates of death.
\q
14:
Oh, that I might proclaim all your praise.\q In the gates of the daughter of Zion
\q I will rejoice in your salvation!


\q
15:
The nations have sunk down into the pit that they made;\q their feet are caught in the net that they hid.
\q
16:
Yahweh has made himself known; he has executed judgment;\q the wicked is ensnared by his own actions.
\qs Selah\qs*


\q
17:
The wicked are turned back and sent to Sheol,\q all the nations that forget God.
\q
18:
For the needy will not always be forgotten,\q nor will the hope of the oppressed be forever dashed.


\q
19:
Arise, Yahweh; do not let man win against you;\q may the nations be judged in your sight.
\q
20:
Terrify them, Yahweh;\q may the nations know that they are mere men.
\qs Selah\qs*
